comments.body: Was the real `crypto/rand` slow enough to matter?
Ironically this bit of code was copied from another area of the repo... Shall I get rid of this? I doubt it makes any/much difference.
I am fine with removing it but do not feel strongly.

I think this test is incomplete (you are missing usages).  Running it locally:

```
=== RUN   TestHandle
=== RUN   TestHandle/should_sign_if_signerName_is_kubernetes.io/kube-apiserver-client
    TestHandle/should_sign_if_signerName_is_kubernetes.io/kube-apiserver-client: signer_test.go:121: expected one Update action but got 0
=== RUN   TestHandle/should_sign_if_signerName_is_kubernetes.io/kube-apiserver-client-kubelet
    TestHandle/should_sign_if_signerName_is_kubernetes.io/kube-apiserver-client-kubelet: signer_test.go:136: expected one Update action but got 0
=== RUN   TestHandle/should_sign_if_signerName_is_kubernetes.io/legacy-unknown
=== RUN   TestHandle/should_sign_if_signerName_is_kubernetes.io/kubelet-serving
    TestHandle/should_sign_if_signerName_is_kubernetes.io/kubelet-serving: signer_test.go:166: expected one Update action but got 0
=== RUN   TestHandle/should_do_nothing_if_an_unrecognised_signerName_is_used
=== RUN   TestHandle/should_do_nothing_if_not_approved
=== RUN   TestHandle/should_do_nothing_if_signerName_is_nil
--- FAIL: TestHandle (0.02s)
    --- FAIL: TestHandle/should_sign_if_signerName_is_kubernetes.io/kube-apiserver-client (0.01s)
    --- FAIL: TestHandle/should_sign_if_signerName_is_kubernetes.io/kube-apiserver-client-kubelet (0.00s)
    --- PASS: TestHandle/should_sign_if_signerName_is_kubernetes.io/legacy-unknown (0.00s)
    --- FAIL: TestHandle/should_sign_if_signerName_is_kubernetes.io/kubelet-serving (0.00s)
    --- PASS: TestHandle/should_do_nothing_if_an_unrecognised_signerName_is_used (0.00s)
    --- PASS: TestHandle/should_do_nothing_if_not_approved (0.00s)
    --- PASS: TestHandle/should_do_nothing_if_signerName_is_nil (0.00s)
FAIL
```
